ppe_requirements.respiratory: Full-face NIOSH-approved respirator with organic vapor and formaldehyde cartridges for concentrations <0.75 ppm. SCBA required for >0.75 ppm or unknown concentrations.
ppe_requirements.skin: Nitrile or butyl rubber gloves (breakthrough time >8 hours). Chemical-resistant suit for high exposure or liquid contact.
ppe_requirements.eye: Chemical safety goggles or full-face respirator. Face shield for splash hazard.
ppe_requirements.minimum_level: Level C for <0.75 ppm with engineering controls, Level B for unknown concentrations or emergency response
ppe_requirements.special_notes: IARC Group 1 known human carcinogen (nasopharyngeal cancer, leukemia). Strong sensitizer. Dermal exposure significant. Formaldehyde-specific cartridges required (standard organic vapor inadequate).

emergency_response.fire_hazard: Solutions >30% flammable. Pure gas flammable with wide explosive range (7-73%). Vapors heavier than air.
emergency_response.fire_suppression: Use water spray, dry chemical, CO2, or foam. Water spray to cool containers and dilute vapors. Approach fire from upwind.
emergency_response.spill_procedures: Evacuate area. Ventilate. Neutralize with dilute ammonia or sodium bisulfite solution. Contain with vermiculite or activated carbon. Dispose as hazardous waste.
emergency_response.exposure_immediate_actions: Remove to fresh air immediately. Eyes: flush with water for 15 minutes. Remove contaminated clothing. Wash skin thoroughly. Seek immediate medical attention - potential carcinogen and respiratory toxin. Monitor for delayed pulmonary edema.
emergency_response.environmental_hazards: Toxic to aquatic life. Biodegrades rapidly. Report spills >100 lbs to CERCLA. Prevent entry to waterways.
emergency_response.special_hazards: KNOWN HUMAN CARCINOGEN (IARC Group 1) - nasopharyngeal cancer and leukemia established. Severe respiratory irritant. Strong sensitizer causing occupational asthma. Lachrymator (causes tearing). Polymerizes on standing, especially with impurities.

storage_requirements.temperature_range: Store below 25°C (77°F). Refrigeration recommended for solutions to prevent polymerization.
storage_requirements.ventilation: Local exhaust ventilation mandatory. Fume hood for small quantities. Outdoor storage for large quantities.
storage_requirements.container_material: Stainless steel, glass, or polyethylene. NOT copper or copper alloys (catalyzes oxidation).
storage_requirements.segregation: Separate from oxidizers, acids, and bases. Flammable storage if concentration >30%.
storage_requirements.quantity_limits: Minimize quantities. OSHA requires <100 gallons or 1,000 lbs inside buildings.
storage_requirements.special_requirements: Stabilized with methanol (10-15%) to prevent polymerization. Label as carcinogen with appropriate warnings. Post carcinogen work area signs. Secondary containment required. Emergency eyewash and shower within 25 feet.

reactivity.stability: Pure formaldehyde unstable. Solutions polymerize on standing, especially without stabilizer (methanol).
reactivity.polymerization: Polymerizes to paraformaldehyde, especially with impurities, acids, bases, or on cooling. Exothermic reaction.
reactivity.reactivity_hazard: Reacts violently with strong oxidizers. Reacts with phenols forming heat-sensitive explosive compounds. Reacts with nitrogen dioxide forming explosive nitro compounds.

environmental_impact.aquatic_toxicity: Toxic to aquatic life. LC50 (fish, 96h): 7-45 mg/L depending on species.
environmental_impact.biodegradability: Readily biodegradable (>70% in 28 days). Oxidizes to formic acid then carbon dioxide.
environmental_impact.bioaccumulation: Very low bioaccumulation potential. BCF <10. Log Kow: 0.35.
environmental_impact.soil_mobility: High mobility. Does not adsorb significantly. Volatilizes from soil and water surfaces.
environmental_impact.atmospheric_fate: Photolyzes rapidly via hydroxyl radicals. Atmospheric half-life: 1-2 days. Forms formic acid.

detection_monitoring.odor_threshold: 0.05-1 ppm - provides early warning but olfactory fatigue occurs. Do not rely on odor alone.
